abstracts.cdata!:
The project's main objective is to
            meet two of the country's highest priorities; to
            improve the Government's public finance management and
            its urban infrastructural program. The project, itself,
            contains two subprojects dealing with public finance and
            urban development. Both include provision of expatriate
            resident specialists, consulting services, training and
            related local expenditures. The public finance subproject
            seeks to: (i) improve the management by the Caisse
            Congolaise d'Amortissement of existing external
            indebtedness and the acquisition of new borrowings on terms
            appropriate to each development project; (ii) increase the
            Ministry of Finance's capacity to make as required
            short-term adjustments in public finance operations and to
            resolve structural problems; and (iii) increase the
            Ministry's capacity to manage the Government's
            financial relationship with Congo's public enterprise
            system. The urban subproject aims to: (i) increase the
            capacity of municipal and central Government technical
            services; and (ii) increase municipal revenues and improve
            their financial management.
